definition: to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: If credit growth roars on, the Chinese central bank will have a lot of trouble controlling inflation.
sentences.chinese: 如果信貸持續增加，央行控制通貨膨脹將步履維艱。

sentences.english: In the UK. an array of technical fixes is already making 9 life harder for car thieves.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，一系列的技術裝置已經讓盜車賊步履維艱了。

sentences.english: The unreasonable funds construction can make the development of the geologic prospecting units stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 資金結構的不合理使一些地勘單位的發展步履維艱。
